good.name: FixFox
good.description: Overall gameplay is solid, but the story has a lot of padding. Art direction is great. There's also some cool references.

good.name: Project Re:VOLVE
good.description: Amazing and intriguing game. Even though it has some bugs which can softlock you, it's definitely worth playing. If you do get softlocked, you can change levels with Page Up/Page Down buttons on your keyboard.

good.name: Promises to Keep
good.description: Overall story is good but sometimes it's a bit lacking(bad character development, tons of inner monologue). Art direction is good.

good.name: Purrfect Apawcalypse Series
good.description: Solid story. Cute art style is a big plus. Also has a reputation system which affects the story and dialogue.

good.name: Pawtualang Demo
good.description: Has some Undertale/Deltarune vibes. Overall a pretty great experience, however there are some bugs. Last update was a pretty long time ago, so this game might be abandoned.

good.name: The Corner Of Dream
good.description: Nice and responsive controls. Amazing art direction. I spent a lot of time just fucking around with physics and going out of bounds. Unfortunately it seems like it's abandoned.

good.name: Web Fishing
good.description: Animal Crossing-like visuals. Pretty chill game. You have the option to host your own server or play in singleplayer mode.

mid.name: Way Back Home
mid.description: Story and art style is meh. Didn't find it very enjoyable.

mid.name: Anomaly Collapse
mid.description: Played it for 1-2 hours and got bored.

mid.name: Fech The Ferret Demo
mid.description: Controller-focused, keyboard support is an afterthought, which creates a very confusing keyboard layout. No music except in rhythm levels. Demo is very short and can be completed in 30 minutes. Character movement is very buggy and you can easily get stuck or get thrown out of bounds.

mid.name: ATLYSS
mid.description: Played it for 45 minutes and got bored.

mid.name: Sticky Paws DX
mid.description: Crude art style, but it's ok I guess. I didn't find this game as something extraordinary, just a platformer, nothing special.

mid.name: Ornament Tower
mid.description: Looks good on the surface, but I didn't bother completing it, I'm not really a fan of puzzle games.

mid.name: Project Shoreline
mid.description: Nothing much gameplay-wise. Environment and art direction looks good.

mid.name: Shyondemic
mid.description: Day 7 is practically impossible, if it wasn't for this and fetish content I would've put it in Good tier.

mid.name: Valp's Escape
mid.description: Very short demo, but lowkey kinda good.

mid.name: Sweet Mania
mid.description: You feed a creature called Yum, that's it. The only thing keeping this game in Meh tier is the art style.

bad.name: Goodbye Volcano High
bad.description: I don't think I need to explain. This horrid art style will haunt me in my nightmares.

bad.name: Tails from Alteria
bad.description: Utterly broken on low-end devices, dialogue box is FPS-dependent, if your FPS is lower than 60 FPS you have a chance to softlock the game. Also the game seems to be abandoned, so nobody will fix this bug.

bad.name: Modem (aka 全数字梦境漫游)
bad.description: Got stuck at parkour part. There's only one enemy, and it's some kind of twitching transparent blue slab which shoots blue orbs at you, very annoying to kill. No English whatsoever, so good luck.

bad.name: Parsnip
bad.description: Played it for 30 minutes and got bored. Art style is weird.
